com.ibm.avatar.algebra.datamodel

Class TupleList

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.avatar.algebra.datamodel.TupleList

  • public class TupleList
extends Object
    This class provides a container for an ordered bag of Tuple objects. Set-valued attributes are implemented using this class.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean COLLECT_STATS
      Constant COLLECT_STATS=false
      protected boolean finalized
      Flag that is set to true when this list is finalized.
      protected int ntups 
      protected AbstractTupleSchema schema
      Schema for the tuples that this object contains; used for comparison functions.
      protected Tuple[] tuples
      The first ntups elements of this array contain the actual tuples.

    • Field Detail

      • COLLECT_STATS

        public static final boolean COLLECT_STATS
        Constant COLLECT_STATS=false
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • schema

        protected AbstractTupleSchema schema
        Schema for the tuples that this object contains; used for comparison functions.

      • tuples

        protected Tuple[] tuples
        The first ntups elements of this array contain the actual tuples. This array is not allocated until the first tuple is added.

      • ntups

        protected int ntups

      • finalized

        protected boolean finalized
        Flag that is set to true when this list is finalized. Currently used only for collecting overall list length stats.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TupleList

        protected TupleList()
        This constructor is not for customer use. Use the public constructor TupleList(AbstractTupleSchema).

      • TupleList

        public TupleList(AbstractTupleSchema schema)
        Constructor to create an empty TupleList object with the given schema.
        Parameters:
        schema - schema for the tuples in the TupleList

      • TupleList

        public TupleList(TupleList other)
        Constructor to create TupleList object from the given TupleList. This constructor performs deep copy.
        Parameters:
        other - source TupleList

      • toShortString

        public String toShortString()
        Returns a readable version of the set that is formatted for printing and shortened, for error reporting purposes
        Returns:
        a readable version of the set, formatted for printing and restricted to a maximum of 3 tuples

      • add

        public boolean add(Tuple tuple)
            throws IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a tuple to this list.
        Parameters:
        tuple - tuple to be added
        Returns:
        true if the tuple has been successfully added
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • addAll

        public void addAll(TupleList tupleset)
            throws IllegalArgumentException
        Method to add all tuples from the given TupleList to this TupleList.
        Parameters:
        tupleset - source TupleList from which tuples are to be added to this TupleList
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the source tuples do not adhere to this TupleList schema

      • addAllNoChecks

        public void addAllNoChecks(TupleList tupleset)
        Method to add all tuples from a source TupleList to this TupleList. This method adds all tuples, bypassing type checks. Use with caution, or use addAll(TupleList) instead.
        Parameters:
        tupleset - source TupleList from which tuples are to be added to this TupleList

      • getElemAtIndex

        public Tuple getElemAtIndex(int index)
        Provides random access within the list. In general, it is recommended to use the iterator() interface instead; use this method only if you absolutely need random access.
        Parameters:
        index - index into the list
        Returns:
        tuple at the indicated index

      • size

        public int size()

        size.

      • reset

        public void reset(AbstractTupleSchema newSchema)
        Prepare this list for reuse by clearing out any tuples and using a new schema.
        Parameters:
        newSchema - schema for tuples that will be added to this list after this call

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Remove all the tuples from this TupleList.

      • done

        protected void done()
        Identifies the singleton iterator as unused without clearing the tuples in this list. To clear the tuples, use clear().

      • iterator

        public TLIter iterator()
        Returns a pointer to the singleton iterator over this TupleList.
        Returns:
        pointer to the singleton iterator over this TupleList; the caller is responsible for resetting the iterator when finished

      • newIterator

        public TLIter newIterator()
        Returns a new iterator that is not associated with this TupleList and can be disposed of freely by the caller.
        Returns:
        a new iterator that is not associated with this TupleList and can be disposed of freely by the caller

      • sort

        public void sort(Comparator<Tuple> sortOrder)
        Method to set the Comparator that is used to sort the tuples in this TupleList.
        Parameters:
        sortOrder - tuple comparator to sort the tuples in the TupleList

      • sort

        public void sort(Comparator<Tuple> comp,
                 MemoizationTable mt)
        Sort the tuples according to an arbitrary sort order, including sort orders that require access to a thread-local state.  Performs necessary locking and state management to ensure that the sort operation is thread-safe, even if the comparator is shared among multiple threads.
        Parameters:
        comp - comparator object for comparing pairs of tuples  
        mt - MemoizationTable object; currently, this object is only needed if comp is an instance of com.ibm.avatar.algebra.datamodel.SlowComparator

      • createDummyTupleList

        public static TupleList createDummyTupleList()
        Factory method to create a TupleList.
        Returns:
        a new instance of TupleList

      • overrideSchema

        public TupleList overrideSchema(AbstractTupleSchema newSchema)
        Reinterpret the tuples of this TupleList as being from a different schema. Allows one to perform "virtual" projection operations over tuples.

        NOTE: This method creates a SHALLOW copy of the internal list of tuples.

        Parameters:
        newSchema - new schema to attach to the tuples.
        Returns:
        this object, if the schemas are the same; otherwise, a shallow copy of this TupleList, with a different schema pointer.
